intro: Psychotria fractistipula, commonly known as the Ecuadorian psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as cloud forests. Psychotria fractistipula is also noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its foliage and floral display.
